intro: Schomburgkia lyonsii, commonly known as the Lyon's spider orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance, with long, slender petals and a distinctive, elongated spur. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Schomburgkia lyonsii is considered a vulnerable species.
